Blastula xenopus.Definition: An early stage of embryonic development where the blastomeres become arranged around the outside, with a central fluid filled cavity, the blastocoel (3 to 7 hours) OR the stages from 64-cell embryo to Nieuwkoop and Faber stage 9, during which the solid morula acquires an internal cavity. (Xenopus anatomy and development: http://purl.org/obo/owl/XAO#XAO_1000003)
